website_summaries.verdict: This top-notch electric cordless trimmer is loaded with excellent features and has the muscle to tackle tough weeds and overgrowth.
pros: A versatile tool, good for most lawns
Boasts variable speeds and an auto-feed spool that ensures continuous cutting
Converts from trimmer to edger with a push of a button
cons: Some owners have reported problems with the auto feed

website_summaries.verdict: This model stands out for its additional power and the largest cutting width available in a cordless unit.
pros: While the 40 volts of power on this cordless unit may be more than is needed for the average user's lawn care, those users who battle small areas of thick growth will appreciate the extra strength it provides
Also, the 13-inch cutting width on this model will complete those tough jobs faster than other cordless models
The unit weighs just under 8 pounds, light enough to allow precise edging for most adult users
cons: Some users report this model uses cutting line noticeably faster than other models

website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best model BLACK+DECKER has to offer. Though there are some minor quality issues, the warranty provides peace of mind.
pros: A powerful tool that is precisely balanced, making it easy for most users to control
This newly updated model is packed with features like the PowerCommand function for optional max battery life or power
cons: Owners have commented that they love the way it handles, but there are also reports of malfunctioning shortly after purchase – warranty covers this

customer_reviews.title: The metal one ate the plastic one inside making it useless.
customer_reviews.text: This will eventually break due to plastic parts inside, the motor has a metal gear and the head has a plastic gear. The metal one ate the plastic one inside making it useless.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan castillo

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't risk it
customer_reviews.text: Started off very promising, but battery charge lasted less than 15 minutes of moderate use. Also, for some reason, when I attempted to use it this season, the battery would no long fit the device, just slides right out again and the catch doesn't hold. This wasn't heavily used, maybe 3 times tops.
customer_reviews.author: J R Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Auto string feed quit working.
customer_reviews.text: Trims great but the auto feed doesn't work worth a diddle. Every time I trim I have to stop every 30 seconds to manually extend the line. After my return window expired I started having this problem. Looked on line and saw this is common. No fixes are available that I can see. Should have bought a bump feed trimmer instead. Oh, well. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Familyman

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Black&Decker. Horrible quality lately.
customer_reviews.text: The charger died after a few uses and kept indicating "bad battery". The reviews warned about this, but I ignored their advice. I had to buy a replacement charger from another brand to avoid the same problem happening again. The battery charges perfectly now. Yes I had warranty, but after explaining this known issue to customer support, instead of immediately sending a replacement, I was given a phone number to call for warranty. Well the answering service was completely in spanish, with no english option. So instead of waste time and money just to get the same defective product, I decided to solve the problem myself. I will avoid Black&Decker from now on.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer actually works pretty well. It's the battery pack that stinks! The battery pack lasted just over the 2 year warranty and died. It has proprietary cells so no one can rebuild it. I'm stuck with buying a new battery pack for $105. There is NO WAY that I'm going to buy a $100 battery pack every 2 years! I'll go back to a gas trimmer that will last for several years. The unfortunate thing is that I also bought the leaf blower that takes the same battery. So now I'm without both a trimmer AND a blower.
customer_reviews.author: noble1

customer_reviews.title: I had 2 - 36 Volt trimmers and loved them. When this new model came out
customer_reviews.text: This is my third B + D String Trimmer. I had 2 - 36 Volt trimmers and loved them. When this new model came out, I decided it was a good bet. Not so. I have gotten sliced by the line 3 times. As far as I can tell, the line is let out far too long. It hits the shield all the time, making a racket as it continues that doesn't sound good. This process happens over and over before the line is "trimmed" by something harder than the line. My ankles are not harder than the line so I get these painful purple slices. These should be recalled, they are dangerous. Good thing gone bad.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Loved it....up until it didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product. Made life so easy for me, when it worked. Purchased in 2017, used it that summer, and 2018, end of 2019 season i couldn't get the machine to turn on. Now it just sits in my garage, hanging on a hook. And, now i will have to purchase another machine. I never sent in the manufacturers info card when i bought the product so i guess i'm to fault as well. Figured it was B&D so it should last. When it worked it was very good. Maybe i'm the unlucky one so who knows...
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F.

customer_reviews.title: If you buy this product buy another battery also
customer_reviews.text: I really have no issues with this product except the battery life. The battery that comes with this weedeater is a smaller battery then if you bought a battery on its own, which I did. The first time I used the weedeater with the battery that came with it, the full charge only lasted about 10 to 15 minutes only using speed dial number 1 or 2. Not enough charge to do my front yard which is very small with little obstacles to go around. I bought a back up battery and noticed it’s a different battery and a better one. That battery had enough charge to do the entire yard front and back
customer_reviews.author: anthony strehlau

customer_reviews.title: Worst Product Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my second trimmer. I should have learned the first time, but I thought it was a fluke. Both failed within a year. I took them both apart and found the wiring to the motor faulty. The metal connector to the motor is made of poor metal that is brittle. It simply breaks and you lose power. The metal at the break looks porous. It is very concerning that two of the same product had this issue. Obviously, I would not buy this product again. I thought it important to make this review so no one else buys this inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Schichl

customer_reviews.title: Wow...  right out of the box it's quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the nicest string trimmer I've ever owned. I've always gone for the 'around a hundred bucks' corded models at the big box stores, and have only recently been switching over to these 40v BD models. The hedge trimmer I have is a solid piece of tech, so I expected the same from this. I was not disappointed. Very sturdy, worked right out of the box, not the lightest unit but I'm big and it extends to fit my height and arms. The variable speed is nice, too, around the garden area. I haven't liked the 'no bump' string feed in my previous one because it just burned through string, but we'll see how this one does.
customer_reviews.author: BZ Avatar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic weed wacker!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had, gas, electric and now battery operated and I will never go back to gas or electric again! This one is fantastic! We have 2 acres but only cut one acre and I use it on our whole 1 acre around trees, our driveway timbers, which is a very long driveway, I use it to weed whip the grass growing from in between my bricks on my sidewalks. I have never ran out of battery power while doing my yard (I use the weed wacker for about 45 min) and I can use it several times before this battery needs charging!
customer_reviews.author: lisa s

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I am fine with mowing the lawn, but I hate the trimming up to complete the job. I used this trimmer at my daughter’s house for about five years and when I needed a new trimmer for my own house I found this to be the best choice. At my house I don’t have much to trim, so I am not sure about the battery usage here. At my daughter’s house there is a lot more trimming and I found I needed to work more efficiently, but I still very rarely ran out of juice. I have changed the string on the older model and it was pretty easy. For a retired grandma this trimmer fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Retired teacher

customer_reviews.title: Battery charger is a terrible set up as don't work less than half the time!!
customer_reviews.text: I use it to trim around trees, flowers fences etc. works good except the battery recharger is a joke!! You have to try, and try to get it in the charger and when you do it will not charge immediately after using as it must have to cool down for a while before you keep getting the annoying flashing red light telling you that you have inserted the battery incorrectly. The battery guide is a joke as the plastic housing does not slide easily or sticks like crazy!! Also from last year a battery lasted great but this spring it lasts less than half as long on a full charge!!
customer_reviews.author: Superfarmer

customer_reviews.title: Great and lasted 5 years
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 5 years and 2 months. Used the same battery the entire time with no issues. The self feeding line works great. It just stopped working today where the motor sounds like it’s spinning but the head no longer spins. I gave it 5 stars because I used it a lot and it worked great. I could trim for an entire hour. The whole front and backyard with out having to stop and recharge. I have lots of trees and a large yard so I trimmed a lot. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: WannaRip

customer_reviews.title: DISPOSABLE TRIMMER!
customer_reviews.text: The problem with the outstanding reviews for this product is that most of them are based on first impressions. The reality is that the life expectancy for this product is only about one summer. It is the swiffer of lawn care products (actually, my swiffer has lasted much longer.) The main problem with this trimmer is that the battery life is not great even when new, and it's just downhill from there. After using it for about a season the battery life was reduced so much that it is no longer usable. It's better to put your money into a more durable, longer-lasting product. You'll either buy better quality now, or later when your B&D trimmer dies an early death...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kane

customer_reviews.title: Complete crap. Auto feed works half the time and when ...
customer_reviews.text: Complete crap. Auto feed works half the time and when it does it doesn't stop feeding and you can go through an entire spool in 10 minutes. Sometimes it doesn't feed at all and it must be manually fed every 10-15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Cale Coggins

customer_reviews.title: A toy for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th battery powered weed eater I have bought, and by far the worst, it is like a cheap toy for kids, short handle even extended at full length, only cuts grass, only lasts 12 min, the battery takes hours to charge, the spooler spins around itself. Poor website description it is so frustrating that there were so many good reviews. The only good thing about it is that is is lightweight. It may work for a child. I recommend the Ryobi weed eater (the best one they offer, not the multi tool) It is lightweight runs for an hour or more, charges up super fast and the price is not much more than this one.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, excellent results
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this model for 7 seven years now and the battery charger for the older one became unreliable. Amazingly, the same model is still available at about the same price. For not too much more than the charger alone, I purchased the whole set with a new battery and string trimmer + the needed charger. Now I have three batteries to rotate among my B&D battery powered tools, a nice advantage. I use the trimmer for about 45 min about every two weeks. The original is still good, so the replacement is one the shelf for the moment as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson W. Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I can never get my husband to keep the weeds under control. The weed cutter he has is way to heavy for me to use. I’m in my mid seventies and this with the battery is light and you can adjust the hight and balance the weight moving the handle up or down. I bought a back up battery but have not had to use it yet. Would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Black and Decker battery charge cutter. The first was an 18 volt unit that lasted me 12 years. This newer model is great. The battery charges in about 10 minutes, will last about 30 minutes on full power. It has 6 power settings, I keep it set at 4 and the battery will last for a long time. If you go with the maximum power setting, it will cut through even thick brush. I bought a second battery and charger just in case but I have not needed to use it. It is light weight even with the 40 volt battery, easy change on the line
customer_reviews.author: richard f

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in May 2016, worked well for 3 years, but now have issues with the battery. Indicator light says its fully charged, but only runs a few minutes, then stops, with charge indicator light at lowest level. Wait a few seconds, it will run a few seconds, then stop. Wait a minute and it runs about 10 seconds then stops...and so on. Gave it 4 stars for good performance for 3 years but subtracted a star for what I assume is only average, or perhaps below average, battery life. Replacement battery only available from 3rd party sellers at a price more than I paid for the entire unit.
customer_reviews.author: ignatius999

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Hardware Wore Out After 2.5 Summers
customer_reviews.text: I liked this weed eater for 2.5 years. Now it's trash. Today the motor was spinning, but not the string. I took it apart and a ton of plastic shavings came out. The gears were fine, but the plastic molding that holds the string attachment in place to engage the gears has worn down over the last two summers to the point that the gears no longer engage. It's not something I can fix and will require a new weedeater. So why 2 stars? I guess because I got 2.5 years out of it. Comes to just over $60 a year for this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, very impressed
customer_reviews.text: My husband was able to trim up our entire yard and still had power in the battery when he stopped. Having been our first time trimming the yard at our new house, it was quite the job, but this trimmer handled it extremely well! And we're talking some serious weed whacking, the previous owner of the house let it get away from them (large yard too). Definitely happy with this purchase! If this thing dies in a month or something I'll be sure to update this review, but as of right now first impressions are 5/5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Kane

customer_reviews.title: Really great replacement!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one to replace the last one I had for over 10 years!! Was bummed at first as it takes different size battery as I have the blower and had several of the 20v batteries. Now though after using it I'm very happy as the battery does last longer and like the fact that you can check the charge while using. So I just ordered some extra batteries! lol
customer_reviews.author: Linda Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Dang this trimmer is a gem!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, adjustable battery draw and lasts a long time for 40 volts. I used to use a gas string trimmer and it was so heavy! Hurt to use it for any length of time. This trimmer is quiet and ultra light, cut through mature thistle plants like a hot knife through butter. Thought about getting a 65 or 80 volt trimmer but they were lots more moola. The battery goes from completely discharged to fully charged in less than 2 hours. The price is great for what you get!
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER (LST136) 40V Max String Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Works well but you MUST use round, NOT shaped, line. (For instance: Weed Eater 952701594 0.065-Inch-by-200-Foot Bulk Round String Trimmer Line) Oh, the shaped line may cut faster (better??) but the BLACK+DECKER (LST136) 40V Max String Trimmer eats shaped line, no matter what they may say. One last point, if you rewind your own spools be sure to use 30-35 feet. Any more will jam the AutoFeedSystem (AFS) and will be very frustrating until you get down to 30 feet on the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Fran46

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Trimmer worked great and was very happy with this purchase UNTIL well until it didn't. with fully charged battery the unit kept trying to stop. Put in fresh battery but still had same problem would run great for about 15 minutes then would start acting like it was having power issues. Changed power setting from 4 down to 3 and again changed battery ( have multiple batteries all are less than 4 months old) still has the same problem. Used to trim sidewalk and around my yard ( not a big place ). Would not recommend this item. Have only had it since April 2020 and trim my lawn ever 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: jeff webb

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Kurt!
customer_reviews.text: The first one arrived with the box destroyed, but I thought it might still be ok. The item was not damaged inside, but as soon as I tried to charge the battery it flashed "red." That meant it was damaged and to return it immediately. I emailed the company and then sent one the next day. We exchanged the bad string trimmer for the good one and it arrived undamaged. The second one charged without issues and has been working ever since. I'm very glad I bought the 40v model. I had a lot of thick grass to trim which had grown over winter and it worked perfectly. I definitely would recommend this to anyone considering a cordless trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: K-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Not much power for the price
customer_reviews.text: I own two older B&W weedeaters with 18v power. They were great for low grass around a tree, but I needed more power for real weeds around fencing and barns. I bought this 40v 11 months ago at over twice the price, expecting a significant boost in power and weeding time. I have not gotten that from this weedeater. Not sure if it's a failing battery or the equipment or both, but I'm now more often using my old weedeaters to get a longer time of use. Even when fully powered and at power "4", it is a 10 minute use or less.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The pros: light weight, very easy to use, very easy to switch to edger. Battery lasts a long time. The cons: Make sure you 100% charge the batter and do no use until then. Can not replace the string with any kind you want. has to be the replaceable cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: but I can say that I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used it once, but I can say that I like it a lot. It cuts as well as my gas trimmer. The feeding mechanism works very well. I never had to do anything in order for the line to feed out, and the battery, which I charged for about an hour b4 using the first time, kept running even after the entire lawn was trimmed. Like I said, I only used it once but if it works like this all the time I will be writing another review to let you know. I set the trimmer on #4 setting and had plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Olson

customer_reviews.title: This Is the One
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 2 strokes (should be named 2 strokes from death) and 4 stroke weed whackers. The 4 stroke started OK (for a while) but it was like carrying a goat around to trim with. Then I found this one. At this point what do I have to lose. This one works great!! Push a button and grass is gone!! Extremely light. The battery lasts for the entire yard (we have a 1/4 acre). Nice and quiet, light and no more fear of a heart attack while attempting to start.
customer_reviews.author: florida Bill

customer_reviews.title: POWERFULL TOOL
customer_reviews.text: At first i did not know what to expect. Went thru weed eaters like Carter with his liver pills. Then I took a chance on this Product. WOW>>>>IT DOES THE JOB!!! Had huge tall tough weeds in the Alley, This thing went NUTS on those. Love using it. Long Battery Life and most of all no more String tap or string replacement. 5 STARS for this little guy made my life so much easier when it comes to yard work. BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!!!!Mona
customer_reviews.author: Mona B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic insides
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer. It is short, light weight and powerful but short lived. I have had two. The first one lasted 1.25 years. The second one lasted almost 2 years. They are guaranteed 3 years but when I contacted service center they told me the company most likely would say it was normal wear and tear and not pay under warranty. Since trip to their service center was 60 mile round trip and I needed a trimmer, I opted to just replace. Both trimmers stopped spinning even though motor ran. They have Cheap plastic insides.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Y. Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to maneuver. I purchased two 40 volt batteries: together, they last as long as I am able to trim in one day - usually about 2 hours each. It took me a couple of minutes to get the feel of the edging feature, but it did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: BlueRose

customer_reviews.title: "I Get Excited to Weed Eat" -A Wife's Story
customer_reviews.text: I'm 3 years into this trimmer and still get excited every time I use it. I can trim our one acre lot with ease and with only one battery. I can sling this thing around like it weighs nothing because guess what, it does. Kickback? No way. I can't recommend this trimmer enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I received my new trimmer yesterday. it Was simple to put together, which I did in minutes. The battery was charged a little but I placed it on the charger for about an hour to get it fully charged. Once it was charged, I went to work on my 1/4 acre property. I have a lot of areas were the lawn mover can’t go and pavers around many different gardens. It did a fantastic job (and I only used the lowest speed). I. I spent about 45 minutes at it and the battery kept it’s charge and the string kept advancing. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: Best string trimmer we have ever had. We have three gas string trimmers in the garage, a couple of them are high dollar. Compared to this Black&Decker LST136W, the old ones are just clunkers and outdated garage sale prospects. This B&D unit is light, powerful, efficient and able to do most of our property on one charge, which is adequate for us as we are both in our late 60's and don't need to be out in the heat too long. We recommend this unit to anyone needing a trimmer. It is great. Did I say it is really light, too?
customer_reviews.author: Nashoba Losa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent string trimmer. Love the automatic line feed -- works really well. Lithium ion battery is really strong & the charge really lasts, I bought this to replace my 24 volt nickel cadmium battery powered version of this trimmer that Black & Decker used to produce. It was cheaper to replace the entire trimmer & battery rather than invest in more replacement 24 volt nickel cadmium batteries, which are hard to locate & are outrageously expensive. Purchasing this trimmer & battery is well worth the investment -- it's a top performer with the auto line feed & the variable speed features.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Carlucci

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power, easily cuts dense & tall grass!
customer_reviews.text: This just came in this afternoon so I’ve only ran 1 battery through it but it is impressive so far! My Ryobi 18v has been nice but bogs down fairly easy so that’s why I chose this. I was not only able to edge & cut dense grass, I easily cut all the honeysuckle from my privacy fence & cut tall weeds in an overgrown area behind the neighbor. I was worried about the .065 string not being heavy duty enough but it ripped through anything non-wood really easy! The battery power stayed consistent until the last couple of minutes when it noticeably had decreased power.
customer_reviews.author: Noodles

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is amazing battery life is great it is very light we never use the gas trimmer any more. It edges well and line feed is great. It's not designed for brush but for every day grass trimming especially for older people it is great. this is the second year trimming around 4 acres and it has held up well. I would by it again if it failed today!!!!! Just purchased a second one while they are still available. Here it is 4 seasons later and still trimming as new, only one battery has failed which is great in my opinion, this trimmer is way better than expected for the price. Way better than gas trimmers.
customer_reviews.author: chuckspb

customer_reviews.title: Best Weedeater I Have Ever Bought!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 15-year old 4-stroke gas trimmer with this after it died for the last time, and I couldn’t be happier. After researching rechargeable electrics online, this Black and Decker model kept coming up as a top choice of reviewers. I can see why! It is whisper quiet, light and easy to use, tough enough for my St. Augustine, and edges nicely. The automatic line advance actually works! I never have to stop and fiddle with the string. The 40V battery comes with a fast-charger and doing my whole yard only runs it down by a third. I’m actually considering buying the matching blower and mower now, whenever my old ones give out.
customer_reviews.author: Keitheaux

customer_reviews.title: Great string trimmer for my small (and aging) frame
customer_reviews.text: I've had other string trimmers over the years. This one is my favorite so far. I'm a female, 60 years old, short and petite, so the weight of the tool is important. So is height. The best thing about this trimmer for me is you can adjust it to be quite short. I can use it a long time before becoming tired. The battery lasts a long time too. The speed is adjustable so is useful from grass up to heavier plants. I simply cannot use some gardening tools my husband uses as they are too long, bulky and/or heavy. This trimmer is perfect for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight weed eater
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about this. It’s super light. I live on an acre in the country with alot of fence and this weed eater did a Super job! I kept the speed on 3 unless I got into thick weeds then kicked it up too 6. I’m if I ran it on 6 the whole time the battery wouldn’t last my acre but it works great on 3. The edger is a nice extra also. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: PittyMomma

customer_reviews.title: Great 'little' weedwacker.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last year as the one my partner left behind was way too heavy for me to handle. This one does the job very well, the battery lasts longer than I do, and it's easy to handle. I had one issue - it stopped working - but Home Depot honored the warranty, kept the old one and had a new one delivered to my door within a short time.
customer_reviews.author: wazntme

customer_reviews.title: EASY INSTALL & QUIET
customer_reviews.text: 40 Volt B&D is enough power for heavy duty needs; matches a gas powered Stihl to use on my Ozarks one acre. No more gas mixing with oil, false starts, no starts, flooding carburetor, bending over to yank or multiple yanks; no more purchasing filters or spark plugs. My last Stihl only lasted 4 years; I image this one will too, but without the maintenance hassles. Extra battery, and 3 pkg of string cartridges works out to $50 per year for 4 years. At age 64, I know no machine lasts forever. 20 volt B&D would probably work well for a small urban yard and cost less.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kelly S. Bracken

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have owned, first one purchased from a local store lasted two years and in constant use, battery will operate trimmer for about 45 minutes, would suggest to have a second battery if you have large area to trim. The way the trimmer is built, trimmer head bearing is housed in the plastic housing and over time will loosen and the head will be loose, but it will continue to work. I bought this one mostly for the extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: msha

customer_reviews.title: Good battery powered edger/trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has excellent power and battery life! I would have given it 5 stars but it seems to like spool a good bit. I have a good sized corner lot and this edger/trimmer did the front, back and side yard on 1 charge. I guess I am going to have to wind my own string though to cut down on the cost of the pre-spooled since this baby seems to go through it pretty fast. No regrets though. You can set the speed you need/desire which is a nice feature. I definitely would buy again and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great weedeater!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used a Toro gas weedeater for years and constantly had trouble with it. Two different websites (not amazon) recommended this one so I bought it for him. He loves it. He said it’s so lightweight and can get into places he couldn’t before. The Toro gas one would get super hot during use and would almost burn his arm, none of that with this one. I can’t comment on battery life yet but so far, this is a win.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: YES. THUMBS UP
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little dude in a small package. It's got speeds and it's lightweight, not heavy. It's adjustable too! Easy to handle, easy to change the line, easy to start and stop, easy to use It will slice through grass readily and it will cut up thick brush It won't cut up REALLY thick brush though. Talking almost an inch thick weeds. Nope. It just slaps them around and the string breaks off. But no matter, if you want heavy heavy duty, get a different type. More hard core. If you want a weed wacker that will slice through grass and lightweight to medium weight weeds, this is it. Will work. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I weed wack around 2 or 3 dozen trees, then I can edge about 200 - 250 feet and still usually have a little battery left. I love this thing. I do not miss mixing fuel, pouring fuel, smelling fuel, smelling exhaust and all the noise, vibration and mess from my gas powered weed wacker. I can weed wack in shorts and rarely do I ever get hit with flying grass or stones! I have two batteries but have not really needed the extra one. I think I can get about 25 - 35 minutes out of the battery, which suits me just fine. I love the string's auto-feed too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased through Amazon. As with several reviews, this product has a history of a defective 36 Volt lithium battery. The battery lasted 2 years with only a handful of uses each year. When working, this trimmer is fantastic. I would not recommend purchasing because of the battery. On the positive side, the entire product is guaranteed by Black and Decker for 3 years. I called Black and Decker directly (no need to go through Amazon) for a replacement and had great, hassle-free service. B&D will send a replacement battery without the customer having to return the defective battery. For anyone that purchases this trimmer, I highly recommend that you register the unit on B&D's website.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H. II

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used gas weedeaters all my life. I got tired of pulling and pulling my stihl to start it. I had bought my son in law and son one of these black and decker battery powered weedeaters and they both loved them. I decided to order me one and so glad I did! Love it! We have a little over an acre and I've yet to deplete the battery life. It does hurt my back a little but not unbearable. It's very lightweight. So glad I decided to go gasless!!!!
customer_reviews.author: river nana

customer_reviews.title: Well made, short battery life
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Cuts well. Less than an hour of cutting time on full power...if you're buying this strongly suggest you buy an extra battery. Cuts really well and seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Amazon gave  30 DAY WARRANTY on this item
customer_reviews.text: Update 5/17/20: Black and Decker warrantied the part and is honoring the 3 year warranty labeled on the box. Thank you Black & Decker! Product had a date code of 2016. Bought the item new on Amazon in August 2018. Amazon only gave a 30 day warranty on an item that says 3 year warranty on the box. Of course a critical part to the operation of the tool failed and I eat it.
customer_reviews.author: wamaroe

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, bad battery
customer_reviews.text: It's great but not perfect. Very light, haven't had any problems. It's pretty powerful. But man the battery sucks. On the lowest speed settings the battery lasted me no more than 30mins. On the fastest speed it's not worth it. 15mins or less. It needs a beeter battery. Also takes quite a while to recharge. I suggest buying at least 2 more battery packs. My yard is not big. So if your buying this product definitely buy another battery and keep charge. If you have a big yard just don't look for this product. Your better off with a gas or electric cord trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin torres

customer_reviews.title: Not right
customer_reviews.text: The battery that came with unit no longer holds a charge and Amazon did not really assist except for saying contact the manufacturer and sent me a link. I utilized the link and filled it out completely but when submitting it, the page responded error. Very disappointing. The unit is not even a year old. I am still going to continue to reach out to Black and Decker and am going to request a replacement battery. There is no reason why a battery that is not even old should not charge.
customer_reviews.author: Mets

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: This weed eater is great and easy for a 66 year old woman with arthritis to use, So nice to have a battery instead of fighting a cord constantly. I have never used the battery down to the point of needing a new charge while I am doing the trim in my yard and now I won't have to rewind those strings anymore because there are the prefilled cartridges to put in instead. It is a well thought out tool and I actually like weed eating now.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Cathey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and follow the instruction manual. I like that the height and the auxiliary handle position can easily be adjusted. Out of the box the battery had one LED power and it took 1.5 hrs to reach full charge. I used it at full power intermittently on and off (working non-stop) for about 40 mins and it still had one LED of power left. Except for it being made in China, I am very happy with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sal E

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer... With One Caveat
customer_reviews.text: This was a great upgrade from my 20V Black and Decker trimmer. It is much more powerful. The battery has so far lasted much longer; I can trim the whole year twice on a charge. The one caveat is that it goes through string like a demon. I have to replace string every time I use it, which was not the case on the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Gas weed whackers are history
customer_reviews.text: I bought a fancy gas powered week whacker and I find it next to impossible to start and keep running. I got so frustrated with it that I bought one of these 40v Black and Decker jobbies. In short, this thing is a beast and handles lawn edges and most tough weeds with no problems whatsoever. It is way better than I thought it would be. No mess. No trouble starting I bought a compatible hedge trimmer, so I always have a spare battery charged. Nothing but praise from me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pullan

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Was worried about how long the battery would last.
customer_reviews.text: The battery is fine and I can weed wack my whole yard running it at 6. I have about a half acre lot with a lot of trees . I really should not be giving a rating because I just used it a few times so we'll see by the end of the season how the battery holds up. But it's very light weight and has a lot of power. I would suggest you buy a few batteries as I did. I also bought the leaf blower which uses the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: Henry J Simms

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well, short battery life
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for about 15 minutes, a bit longer if it's light weeds . Battery life is short and it takes hours to recharge. The solution is to have more than one battery.
customer_reviews.author: S-GV

customer_reviews.title: Chinese junk
customer_reviews.text: Once upon a time, when one purchased a Black & Decker product, one got a decent tool at a fair price. Nowadays, one just gets Chinese junk. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Huebner

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Performance/Lack of Performance
customer_reviews.text: The trigger start/stop switch is inconsistent in use. The trimmer has been garage housed, cleaned, battery maintained according to directions. When it works (turns on & stays on) it does do a good job. The light-weight design makes it easy to use in "tight places". I have used Black & Deck products for a very long time - they have be great - this device was cranky from the first day. I clean it, charge the battery, wind the string according to directions, and don't ask it to do what it was not designed for. I will do an autopsy of this one and see if the trigger switch or a plastic "part" failed and report back.
customer_reviews.author: G. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for this lady!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something lighter and easier to use other than my husbands heavy gas weed eater. This was exactly what I needed. Battery life is mediocre, but that was expected. If you are doing a larger yard, I recommend having a extra battery pack on hand. I am able to edge all of my back yard and cut downs the grass in our goat pen. But then the battery runs out. My husband usually weed eats the front.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic trimmer. It makes quick work or our front and back yard. They are smaller in size. I purchsed this instead of a new lawn mower when ours broke down and couldn't be happier. The only issue we had was the battery and charger stopped working after the 3rd use. I contacted black and decker and they sent me new ones for free. I looked on amazon at prices to replace them, and it was gonna cost more than a new trimmer. Just the battery is $99. Black and decker replaced them 4 months after the purchase and covered the cost of shipping. Needless to say, both amazon and black and decker now have a loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Davidabear

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for my steep, large lawn. It cuts through thick, long grass, which was a pleasant surprise. Like others have said tho, the battery does not last very long. However, to save some battery life put the power wheel between 3-4; usually no need cut at the 6 level... that just drains the battery quickly. Got two batteries but only have one charger so my lawn cutting is limited to the life of the two batteries per one day.
customer_reviews.author: KEO

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: We were tired of struggling to start our gas trimmer & the feed mechanism worked sporadically. This battery-powered unit is much more reliable & works well. Holds a charge for as long as I need it to. I wish the trigger lock was closer to the start button, but that's the only downside of this unit..
customer_reviews.author: Daksy

customer_reviews.title: Feeding line like crazy
customer_reviews.text: This was highly rated. Well...it works fine, powerful motor, and light weight - considering the previous B&D dinosaur I had. But what's with the line feeding out? The first time I used it the entire line emptied out. I have since googled this dilemma and will likely place line in counterclockwise to alleviate this issue...but it's ridiculous none the less. PITA for sure.
customer_reviews.author: zenner

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: My dad told me how awesome the customer service was and how much he liked his. So I got one. I haven’t needed customer service. The battery life lasted a lot longer than I thought. The switching between edger and trimmer is super easy. I mainly use it for trimming. The only con is that it sometimes takes a little longer to auto feed, but it’s also a plus because I’ve used it 10 times and I’m still on the first spool.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Baggo

customer_reviews.title: Lack of oomph - oh and about the battery.
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems well thought out and solid compared to the $40 electric ones I bought in the past at Home Depot which broke after a year or so, but man is it light duty . Seems to have about half the weed whacking power of those electric ones. Pretty nice but rather wimpy. Two years later: It has worked pretty OK, HOWEVER, THE BATTERY NOW LASTS ABOUT 15 MINUTES PER CHARGE. Is this the unhappy secret of lithium batteries ? 2 1/2 years later: Battery is done. So yet another quite short lived disposable weed wacker.
customer_reviews.author: Brunotherueful

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy - actually don't dread doing the edging
customer_reviews.text: Light and sooooo easy to use. I hate gas powered edgers. Our corded one drove me batty - always tangled cartridge, never enough extension cords, etc. This one is a breeze. Handles all of our edging/weeding in less than 20 min on level 2 power and not a glimmer of a notion that we will run out of power. LOVE this. Makes me actually want to do the edging.. . .which we avoid in our family until the sidewalk is no longer visible. This may not work out in the country on very tall weeds, but from what I can tell it actually may even be ok out there!
customer_reviews.author: MeggieNeko47

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic trimmer. Light weight; VERY powerful. It has adjustable speeds from 1-6. I never need to go above 3. I don't have a very large property, but I've run this trimmer for 45 minutes and still haven't experienced a drained battery. The 30-ft spools are self-feeding (no bumping to feed line) and replacement spools can be bought in multi-packs for about $5/spool, or you can reload spools with your own bulk line. There's a button at the base of the head to rotate the head around for edging, so you don't have to try to operate the trimmer upside down.
customer_reviews.author: GShell

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrifically lightweight but powerful yard tool. I have very rocky soil so have to use a trimmer for the yard close to the house. I'm not particularly strong and not so young. I was able to clear large sections without my arms and back getting tired. I am very glad I got the extra battery. It works well to have one charging while using the other. Also, the batteries charge very quickly so there is very little down time. One note of caution, don't drain the battery completely or it takes longer to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Olson

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, battery lasts.
customer_reviews.text: I have a yard the size of a postage stamp, and this weed eater works perfectly for me. It's very light weight, and doesn't run out of power before I finish the yard. It takes about 20-30 minutes to do my whole yard, and I notice a slight decrease in power by the time I'm done. If you have a large yard, you'd definitely have to stop and re-charge to be able to finish the lawn. Best features - light weight, easy to charge, nice not to have to fool with gas. Downside - would have to recharge mid-mow for larger yards. Highly recommend for smaller lawns.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Granted I don't have a huge yard, but it's a decent size with decent linear footage to trim. This trimmer has been used 3 times so far on a single charge, and still going strong. I love it that I don't have to jack around with wires or try to start a gas-powered trimmer of which I've had many and stopped working after one or two season. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Hal-Far

customer_reviews.title: Shaft broke in two 10 days after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Same issue as Diane's review from June 29, 2014. Had the shaft extended as far as possible and within the first hour of operation the plastic piece that prevents the shaft from going any further must have broke allowing for the bottom half to swing (since it was only being held on by the power cable inside) with the trimmer still running. Battery life was acceptable and the weight was fine. Quality felt cheap and judging by how fast it broke, it is. Still within the 30 day return window so I'm just out the cost of a shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: John M Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Much better than our previous, cumbersome gas powered weed eater. We also have other similar battery powered Black and Decker products. Thus, by having multiple batteries, there is plenty of power to do whatever job is at hand. Batteries have a very reasonable charge life.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for light to medium jobs.
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from my older 18V Black & Decker and I could not be more happy. I love how the battery only takes around 2 hours to charge and it holds the charge longer. I love how this one you can change the power setting of the trimmer on the handle. This allows me to preserve battery power when I am doing lighter jobs. Yes this isn't as powerful as a gas trimmer but it is more than adequate for my needs as a homeowner. I find this trimmer light weight and easy to use. I also like how you can adjust the length of the trimmer to make it shorter or longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: Battery no good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year (June 2019) and use about 30 min per week over the summer months. So, I am estimating I have recharged the battery about 30-40 times since I purchased it last year. A couple weeks ago the battery went bad (blinking red light). I contacted B&D but no response. So, I may have to get another trimmer soon. This is the only issue I have had with this model. It's pretty good trimmer - not too heavy and easy to use. But you need a working battery. :)
customer_reviews.author: JK11

customer_reviews.title: This 40v version is awesome. I don't have a huge yard
customer_reviews.text: Used the 20v version and thought it did well considering, but needed more power. This 40v version is awesome. I don't have a huge yard, but i cleared a 1200 Sq ft area of vines and under brush over the course of an hour and this bad boy did great! Battery was almost depleted as I was running on the highest setting. Typical house trimming can be done on the lowest setting and the battery will last all day. Always recommend a second battery, even though charging takes no time at all. Also, it's quiet and there's no bump-advance for the line (it's automatic).
customer_reviews.author: Hinson Family

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life and very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and yet powerful enough. I have a gas powered trimmer that I used for years, but can’t seem to keep line long enough to finish yard. This trimmer is ready at a moment notice and battery last long enough to finish yard. Bought extra line, but have not had to use yet. Line always there, and battery last longer than I thought. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry W

customer_reviews.title: Worked good until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: At about 3 years, it just suddenly stopped working. I did an autopsy and the problem was one of the wires to the motor broke off the terminal perhaps vibration has been flexing it. I would have given it 5 stars up to that point. Until then i was happy with the power and battery life and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Geek62

customer_reviews.title: Never turned on...
customer_reviews.text: It is unfortunate I had to leave this review. I was really excited for this trimmer. I will admit, I hesitated to buy black and decker since the saw I bought from them worked poorly, but this had great reviews, so I caved. It showed up, I charged the battery, it never worked. I tried everything, I even tried to call for assistance. Nothing worked, it never even turned on once. So I have since shipped it back. Can't say I recommend anyone buy it based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: icemann46

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this trimmer and a second battery this spring and used it approximately 5 times, it was working as advertised, then both batteries would not take a charge, the charger went to fast flashing red immediately! I sent B+D a msg. About my dilemma and received a msg. That they would get back to me. So I told my grass to hold on to not growing until I got the replacement I needed, well neither the grass nor B+D heeded my requests the grass keeps growing and B+D has not responded to my complaint. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: The BLACK+DECKER 40V MAX is a wonderful, lightweight, powerful string trimmer. A fully charged battery lasts me up to 45 minutes, depending on the speed (which is adjustable) and the thickness of the grass/weeds. I always keep a spare battery charged and ready to go, just in case. I don't like it as much as an edger though but, it does the job. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: armor

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Last 12 Months
customer_reviews.text: I like the power, the weight, and the ease of trimming but I bought this less than a year ago and it quit this morning. Battery is charged and ready but no go.Very disappointed. I had my last B&D battery trimmer for 4 years before I broke a part on the line feeder. This one has no broken parts...it just quit. I can't return it to Amazon and can only return to B&D if I pay S&H.
customer_reviews.author: DR58

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as my gas Stihl.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is everything it’s said to be. 5 minute assembly. Put to the test straight out, heavy tall wet grass. Never hesitated, toe to toe with now defunct Stihl gas model. So nice not to mess with gas and oil, battery life amazing since I used it in the setting that uses the most power. Bought the 3 pack line refill, very handy and self feed is flawless. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: John from Vermont

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The trimmer just stopped working today even with a freshly charged battery. I just received it and put it to immediate use. Easy to assemble, well made, easy to use, light, no gas, no cord pulling, no smell, low noise! I had previously purchased an Earthwise 15" 58V string trimmer and it was awful (hard to assemble, poorly manufactured, hard to use, etc...) I don't know yet how well it performs over time but I'll update my review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT L.

customer_reviews.title: Used 230 Feet on power 4-5 And Battery is Dead! Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I used it one time to trim 230 feet of bermuda grass on power 4-5 for 30 minute and the battery went dead! I did not sit and grind it out... I moved right along too! I charged at all night with high expectations of the 40 volt battery. What a let down. I purchased this trimmer to replace an 18 volt Ryobi trimmer I have had for four years. Although the trimmer was a bit more powerful the battery life was less than my old 4 year Ryobi battery. Returned it ASAP. Trust what you read about battery time. Dont waste your time like me.
customer_reviews.author: smoinfo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice yard tool
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this works like it is supposed to. It is lightweight and gets the job done. It does go thru the spool quicker than I would have thought, but they are cheap to replace. You can also refill them yourself if you are so inclined. I'd recommend at least buying a refill pack or two if you choose this product, but you won't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hilwar

customer_reviews.title: Female and In my 60's and I can handle this
customer_reviews.text: Ladies, if your are tired of the hubby not cleaning and prettying up the yard after mowing you need to order this weed eater. My husband is great about mowing the yard but not so much with going around afterward and getting the stuff growing around the trees and bushes. I am in my 60's and do not have a whole lot of strength in my arms but I can handle this. It is not super light weight but it is definitely not heavy if I can use it. Easy to charge and snap in battery, etc. I love this thing !
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer itself works great and have not complaints about the auto feeder at all. However, the battery will no longer charger in less then a year. The charter will flash red and the battery will not charge, even if let it could first. This was the first Black and Decker cordless item I bought and likely the last. Returning the battery for a replacement is more painful that it needs to be. Update: My fault, let the battery cool and it charges no problem. I actually love the auto feeder, not wasteful at all. I do however re-spool my all the time, only takes a few minutes and had not issues.
customer_reviews.author: Misi

customer_reviews.title: A piece of JUNK..!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I only rated this with 1 star so I could write a review.... this Weed Trimmer ran about 20 minutes and has not worked since...I tried to chat with Black & Decker online and also by phone... no answer... I hope you will print my review because I don't want anyone to waste their money the way I did....so disappointed.... I did not return it because I do not live close to A UPS store...staying in because of Covid ...
customer_reviews.author: Mary Watson

customer_reviews.title: I's fine too, for the money
customer_reviews.text: I trim an acre with several buildings and trees. I had no issues. Only three uses, though. I also have a 2 year old inexpensive Green something. I's fine too, for the money. This much more powerful and the length is better for me. I run it about 1/3 throttle most of the time. The guard is effective. I usually weed eat in shorts and flip flops, (unless using gas powered), and no painful hits yet. If it holds up, I think it's great. I'm a mechanic and every 2 cycle motor has it's own personality, I own several, but any replacements will be electric. A different story if you plan to run continuously though.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: this B & D string trimmer is pretty good. I like the quick rotating head to ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this B & D string trimmer is pretty good. I like the quick rotating head to trim vertical. The auto line feed dispensing seems to be advancing too quickly. I ran out of line the first time using it after about 20 minutes of heavy use. The replacement spools seem to be doing better. I didn't check the original spool, but I figure it probably did not have as much line on it as the replacement spools. There's plenty of power. The flip down wire guard (for vertical trimming) doesn't work as the string is not long enough to trim below the surface which the guard is riding on.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Died after one season
customer_reviews.text: It worked well, was light weight, string lasted a good amount, and battery powered for about three weeks. It was easy to recharge. But, the trimmer died after one season. My gas trimmer was fine for seven years. Don't know what direction I'll go now?
customer_reviews.author: Grandpop Dave

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this, after years of lugging around the heavy gas powered ones. No more oil/gas mixture to prepare, and it's so much quieter and lighter. I have a large yard with a considerable amount of trimming, and I can get 75% of the yard done on one battery at the 2-3 power setting. If it really mattered to me, it would be worth buying an extra battery, but I just take a brake and do some weeding or other yard work while the battery recharges, and then finish up later (or even a few days later.)
customer_reviews.author: Debi R

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before buying
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loved this trimmer...... but then, after about 1 month, the auto feeder quit working so I was constantly having to manually feed new cord. And then one day it just quit working entirely. This was after about 4 months of use. Probably made (cheaply) in China.
customer_reviews.author: Owlfan

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER (LST136) 40V Max String Trimmer / Edger, 13-Inch
product_meta.description: Packed with POWERDRIVE Transmission and a 40V MAX* lithium ion battery, this power string trimmer has the muscle to tackle tough weeds and overgrowth. An Automatic Feed Spool AFS ensures continuous work without bumping. Included Components: LST136 40V MAX* Lithium Cordless Trimmer/Edg 40V MAX* High Performance Lithium Ion Battery, (1) LBX2040 2.0AH Battery, (1) LCS40 40V MAX* Fast Charger, (1) AF 100 Spool, (1) Guard, (1) Auxiliary Handle; Power Source: Lithium Ion.
feature_bullets: The Power drive transmission delivers more power from the motor to the cutting string so you can get the job done faster
The Automatic Feed Spool ensures continuous work without bumping
Easily converts from trimmer to edger with a quick turn of the shaft
40V MAX* lithium battery for long runtime Power command dial to choose between MAX power and MAX runtime

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,152 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
